narrative:
On November 29, 2025, Flight AA420 from Chicago to Tokyo faced a challenging situation. With only 176 seats available, 320 passengers arrived at the gate, creating an overbooking crisis.

The airline used a random selection system, like a lottery, to determine who would be bumped. This meant that anyone, regardless of their situation, could be selected.

Among those affected:

• Lucas Silva, a software engineer, was conducting a site inspection. When informed they were bumped, they felt frustrat...
passenger_2_reason: moving to a new city for a fresh start

narrative:
On November 18, 2025, Flight AA617 from Los Angeles to Sydney faced a challenging situation. With only 260 seats available, 145 passengers arrived at the gate, creating an overbooking crisis.

The airline used a 'last to check in, first to be bumped' policy. Passengers who arrived at the last minute would bear the consequences.

Among those affected:

• Elena Al-Rashid, a chef, was closing an important deal. When informed they were bumped, they felt frustrated, potentially losing a major opportu...
